longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To provide for a regulatory framework in respect of the practice of dentistry.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Dentists Registration Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this provision are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
subsection.def: Academy of Medicine (醫學專科學院) means the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine established under the Hong Kong Academy of Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 419); (Added 11 of 2006 s. 3)

Chairperson (牙管會主席) means the Chairperson of the Council elected under section 4AAE(1) and includes a person elected under section 4AAE(5)(b) to act in the place of the Chairperson; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
complainant (申訴人) means any person from whom a complaint or information has been received in accordance with regulations made under section 29; (Added 12 of 1968 s. 2. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Continuing Professional Development Committee (持續專業發展委員會) means the committee established under section 5AC(2)(c); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Council (牙管會) means the Dental Council of Hong Kong established under section 4; (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 5)
dangerous drugs (危險藥物) means any drug to which the Dangerous Drugs Ordinance (Cap. 134) applies;

due inquiry (適當的研訊) means an inquiry by the Council conducted substantially in accordance with the procedure provided by regulations made under section 29(1C)(d)(v); (Amended 12 of 1968 s. 2; 80 of 1997 s. 5)
Education and Accreditation Committee (教育及評審委員會) means the committee established under section 5AC(2)(a); (Added 11 of 2006 s. 3. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Examination Committee (考試委員會) means the committee established under section 5AC(2)(b); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
full registration (正式註冊)—see section 2B(a); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
function (職能) means a duty or a power; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
General Register (普通科名冊) means the register of dentists kept under section 7(1); (Added 11 of 2006 s. 3)
Hospital Authority (醫院管理局) means the Hospital Authority established by section 3 of the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)

lay person (業外人士) means a person who is not any of the following—(a)a registered dentist;(b)a person deemed to be a registered dentist under this Ordinance;(c)a person with provisional registration; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Legal Adviser (法律顧問) means a Legal Adviser to the Council appointed under section 4AAF(1)(b); (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Licensing Examination (許可試) means the examination set under section 7A; (Added 34 of 1995 s. 2. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Medical Council (醫務委員會) means the Medical Council of Hong Kong established under section 3 of the Medical Registration Ordinance (Cap. 161);
mental hospital (精神病院) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
non-practising list (非執業名單) means the list mentioned in section 7(1B)(b); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)

practice address (執業地址), in relation to a registered dentist, means—(a)subject to paragraph (b), an address provided by the dentist under section 12G(2); or(b)if a change of the address is reported under section 12G(5)—the address as changed; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Preliminary Investigation Committee (初步調查委員會) means a committee established under section 5AC(2)(e); (Amended & replaced 22 of 2024 s. 5)

premises (處所) includes any place and, in particular, includes the following—(a)any land or building;(b)any vehicle or vessel (other than a sea-going ship as defined in the Merchant Shipping (Seafarers) Ordinance (Cap. 478));(c)any part of any land or building or of any vehicle or vessel mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
prescribed (訂明) means provided by regulations made under section 29;
qualifying degree in dentistry (合資格牙醫學位) means a bachelor degree in dentistry awarded by a university in Hong Kong specified in Schedule 1; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)

registered address (註冊地址)—(a)in relation to a registered dentist or a person with provisional registration, means—(i)subject to subparagraph (ii), an address provided by him or her under section 12G(1); or(ii)if a change of the address is reported under section 12G(5)—the address as changed; and (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 5)(b)(Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 5)
registered specialist dentist (註冊專科牙醫) means a person whose name is contained in the Specialist Register; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
registrant (註冊人) means—(a)a registered dentist;(b)a person with provisional registration; or (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)(c)(Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Registrar (註冊主任) means the Registrar of Dentists as provided for under section 6;
registration (註冊)—see section 2D; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
retention certificate (保留證明書) means a certificate issued under section 12I(3); (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Schedule 4 institution (附表4機構) means an institution specified in Schedule 4; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Schedule 5 institution (附表5機構) means an institution specified in Schedule 5; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Schedule 6 institution (附表6機構) means an institution specified in Schedule 6; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Schedule 7 institution (附表7機構) means an institution specified in Schedule 7; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Secretary (秘書) means the Secretary of the Council appointed under section 4AAF(1)(a); (Added 12 of 1968 s. 2. Amended 11 of 2006 s. 3; 22 of 2024 s. 5)
Specialist Register (專科名冊) means the register of specialist dentists kept under section 7(3); (Added 11 of 2006 s. 3. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 5)

unprofessional conduct (不專業行為), in relation to a person, means an act or omission of the person that would reasonably be regarded as disgraceful or dishonourable by registrants of good repute and competency. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 5)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 15(8)(b), 15A(7)(b), 15K(9)(b), 18(5), 18A(3)(a) and 22(3)(b), an appeal to the Court of Appeal is deemed to be finally determined when the earliest of the following events occurs, whichever is applicable in the circumstances— (Amended 11 of 2006 s. 3; 22 of 2024 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: when the appeal to the Court of Appeal is withdrawn or abandoned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: when the specified period expires without an application for leave to appeal having been made to the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: if, before the expiry of the specified period, an application for leave to appeal is made to the Court of Appeal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: when the application is withdrawn or abandoned;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the application is refused, when the specified period expires without an application for leave to appeal having been made to the Court of Final Appeal; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the application is granted, when the appeal to the Court of Final Appeal is withdrawn, abandoned or disposed of; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: if, before the expiry of the specified period, an application for leave to appeal is made to the Court of Final Appeal—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: when the application is withdrawn, abandoned or refused; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the application is granted, when the appeal to the Court of Final Appeal is withdrawn, abandoned or disposed of. (Added 10 of 2005 s. 54)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—
subsection.def: application for leave to appeal (上訴許可申請) means an application made to the Court of Appeal or the Court of Final Appeal under section 24 of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484) for leave to appeal to the Court of Final Appeal from a judgment of the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for leave to appeal made to the Court of Appeal, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the period of 28 days within which the notice of motion referred to in section 24(2) of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484) is required to be filed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, on an application made within the 28-day period referred to in subparagraph (i), the Court of Appeal extends that period, the period as so extended; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an application for leave to appeal made to the Court of Final Appeal, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the period of 28 days within which the notice of motion referred to in section 24(4) of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484) is required to be filed; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if, on an application made within the 28-day period referred to in subparagraph (i), the Court of Final Appeal extends that period, the period as so extended. (Added 10 of 2005 s. 54)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a complaint or information involves a suitability issue if the complaint or information concerns the question of whether the name of a registered dentist should be included in, or removed from, the Specialist Register. (Added 11 of 2006 s. 3)

section.name: s2A
section.heading: Meaning of practising dentistry etc.
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person practises dentistry if, for the purpose of gain or otherwise—

subparagraph.content: the person provides, or attempts to provide, any one or more of the services specified in Schedule 2; or

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: references to dentist, dentistry and the carrying on of the practice of dentistry are to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s2B
section.heading: References relating to registration of dentists
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person with full registration is a person whose name is contained in Part 1 of the General Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person with provisional registration is a person whose name is contained in Part 2 of the General Register;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person with limited registration is a person whose name is contained in Part 3 of the General Register;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person with temporary registration is a person whose name is contained in Part 4 of the General Register; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person with special registration is a person whose name is contained in Part 5 of the General Register,

section.continued: and references to full registration, provisional registration, limited registration, temporary registration and special registration are to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s2D
section.heading: References relating to registration and related expressions
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person is registered if the person is—

subparagraph.content: a person with full registration, a person with provisional registration, a person with limited registration, a person with temporary registration or a person with special registration; or

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 6)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: references to registration are references to registration under this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Restrictions on practising dentistry

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of any regulations made under section 29(1A)(d), a person, not being a registered dentist or a person with provisional registration, who— (Amended 80 of 1997 s. 6; 22 of 2024 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: practises dentistry, or holds himself or herself out (whether directly or by implication) as being qualified to practise dentistry, within Hong Kong commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: practises dentistry on a person within Hong Kong which results in personal injury to that person commits an offence and is liable—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to imprisonment for 7 years. (Amended 12 of 1968 s. 3; 79 of 1984 s. 7; 68 of 1986 s. 9; 80 of 1997 s. 89)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: If a person commits an offence under subsection (1) while acting as an employee of another person (employer), the employer also commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 years. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: If an employer is charged with an offence under subsection (1B) because of an offence under subsection (1) (specified offence), it is a defence for the employer to establish that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified offence was committed without the employer’s knowledge; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the employer exercised all due diligence to prevent the commission of the specified offence. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: An employer may commit an offence under subsection (1B) whether or not the employee has been prosecuted for, or convicted of, the specified offence. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: An employer charged with an offence under subsection (1B) is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for a defence under subsection (1C) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 8)

subsection.content: Nothing in this section shall operate to prevent the extraction of teeth for the relief of pain, or the application of remedies for such purposes, by a medical practitioner registered under the Medical Registration Ordinance (Cap. 161).
For the purposes of this section a person who fraudulently procures himself to be registered under this Ordinance shall be deemed not to have been so registered. (Added 68 of 1986 s. 9)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Establishment and composition of Dental Council

subsection.content: There shall be established within Hong Kong a council to be called the “Dental Council of Hong Kong”. (Amended 79 of 1984 s. 2; E.R. 7 of 2020)

subsection.leadIn: The Council shall consist of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar; (Replaced 4 of 1988 s. 3)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 consultant dental surgeon of the Dental Services of the Department of Health appointed by the Chief Executive; (Replaced 4 of 1988 s. 3. Amended L.N. 76 of 1989; 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist, who is a full-time member of the teaching staff of the Faculty of Dentistry of the University of Hong Kong, nominated by the University of Hong Kong and appointed by the Chief Executive; (Added 79 of 1984 s. 2. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist nominated by the Board of Governors of The Prince Philip Dental Hospital and appointed by the Chief Executive; (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1 registered specialist dentist nominated by the Council of the Academy of Medicine and appointed by the Chief Executive; (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 2 registered dentists nominated by the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association and appointed by the Chief Executive; (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist, who satisfies the condition specified in subsection (3), nominated by the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association and appointed by the Chief Executive; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 10)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: 4 registered dentists appointed by the Chief Executive; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 10)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 10)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: 5 lay persons appointed by the Chief Executive. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(f), the condition is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: as at the date of nomination, the person has been, for at least 10 years in aggregate—

subparagraph.content: a person with full registration whose name is contained in the practising list; or

a person whose name is contained in the form mentioned in regulation 3(a) of the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the commencement date* of section 35 of the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: is or was a member of the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association elected in accordance with the articles of association of the Hong Kong Dental Association; and
as at the date of nomination, has served as such a member for at least one full term. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 10)

section.name: s4AA
section.heading: Term of office

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and section 4AAB, a member of the Council described in section 4(2)(ba), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) or (k)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.content: A member of the Council described in section 4(2)(b), (ba), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) or (k) may at any time resign by giving written notice to the Chairperson or the Secretary.

section.name: s4AAB
section.heading: Vacation of office

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

section.leadIn: The Chief Executive may declare the office of a member of the Council to be vacant if the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to a sentence of imprisonment for an offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the subject of an order made under section 18 or 18A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: becomes bankrupt, or enters into a composition or arrangement with his or her creditors without paying them in full;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is detained in a mental hospital;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: is, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, unable or unfit to perform the functions of the office.

section.name: s4AAC
section.heading: Appointment when vacancy arises during term of office

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 11)
(Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 11)

subsection.content: If, during the term of office (original term) of a member of the Council described in section 4(2)(b), (ba), (c), (d), (e), (f), (h), (i) or (k), the office becomes vacant, the Chief Executive may make an appointment under that section to fill the vacancy.
A person appointed under subsection (1), (2) or (3) holds office until the end of the original term mentioned in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: qualified person (合資格人士) means a person with full registration whose name is contained in the practising list.

section.name: s4AAD
section.heading: Persons not eligible for appointment etc.

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

section.leadIn: Despite anything in sections 4 and 4AAC, a person is not eligible for appointment or reappointment as a member of the Council if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is subject to a sentence of imprisonment for an offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is the subject of an order made under section 18 or 18A;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is an undischarged bankrupt;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is detained in a mental hospital; or

paragraph.name: e

section.name: s4AAE
section.heading: Chairperson of Council

subsection.content: The members of the Council must elect one of them to be the Chairperson of the Council.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: holds office—

subparagraph.content: for 3 years beginning on the date of election; or
if he or she ceases to be a member of the Council within that 3 years—until the cessation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for re-election.

subsection.content: The Chairperson may at any time resign his or her office by giving written notice to the Secretary.
If the office of Chairperson becomes vacant, the Secretary must convene a meeting of the Council within 3 months of the occurrence of the vacancy for the purpose of electing a Chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chairperson is temporarily unable to perform the functions of his or her office during a period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary must convene a meeting of the Council for the purposes of paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members of the Council must elect one of them at the meeting to act in the place of the Chairperson during the period.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must preside at a meeting held under subsection (4) or (5) until a person is elected as the Chairperson and assumes office; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not vote at the meeting.

section.name: s4AAF
section.heading: Secretary and Legal Adviser

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a person to be the Secretary of the Council; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint one or more than one person to be a Legal Adviser to the Council.

subsection.content: A member of the Council may not be appointed to be a Legal Adviser.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meetings of the Council

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: Except for holding an inquiry mentioned in section 18, the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must meet at the time and in the way specified by the Chairperson; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must meet at a written request of at least 8 members of the Council addressed to the Chairperson. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 13)

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2A), at a meeting of the Council, 8 members of the Council, including at least 4 members who are registered dentists, form a quorum. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 13)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: At a meeting of the Council for holding an inquiry mentioned in section 18, 5 members of the Council, including at least 3 members who are registered dentists and at least one member who is a lay person, form a quorum. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 13)
The validity of any proceedings of the Council shall not be affected by any vacancy among the members thereof or by any defect in the appointment of a member thereof.
Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, all questions before the Council must be decided by a majority of the members of the Council present and voting thereon. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 13)

The Chairperson at any meeting of the Council shall have an original vote and also, if upon any question the votes shall be equally divided, a casting vote except in an inquiry mentioned in section 7E, 9A, 15E, 18 or 27A at which he shall have only an original vote. (Amended 4 of 1988 s. 4; 22 of 2024 s. 13)

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Transaction of business by circulation of papers

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.content: The Council may transact any of its business, other than an inquiry mentioned in section 7E, 9A, 15E, 18 or 27A, by circulation of papers without meeting.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), on the circulation of papers, a written resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which all members of the Council indicate their votes in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: passed by the number of members required for passing the resolution at a meeting of the Council,

subsection.continued: is as valid as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Council by the members who vote on the resolution.

subsection.content: A member may, by giving a written notice to the Chairperson within the period specified in the papers being circulated, request the Chairperson to refer a matter to be determined by circulating the papers to a meeting of the Council for determination. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 15)

If a member gives a notice under subsection (3) in relation to a matter, a resolution that relates to the matter passed in accordance with subsection (2)(b) is invalid to the extent that it so relates.
For the purposes of this section, a reference to the circulation of papers includes the circulation of information by electronic means.

section.name: s5AB
section.heading: Council may provide information to Secretary for Health
section.content: The Council may provide any information to the Secretary for Health if the Secretary for Health requests the information for the formulation of health care policies.

section.name: s5AC
section.heading: Council may establish committees

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: The Council may establish any committee for the better performance of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Council may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: establish the Education and Accreditation Committee in accordance with Part 5;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: establish the Examination Committee in accordance with Part 6;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: establish the Continuing Professional Development Committee in accordance with Part 7;

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 17)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: establish one or more than one Preliminary Investigation Committee in accordance with Part 9.

subsection.content: The functions of a committee established under subsection (2) are those prescribed by this Ordinance.

Subject to subsection (5) and Parts 5, 6, 7, 8 and 9, the Council may appoint a member of the Council, or a person who is not a member of the Council, to be a member of a committee established under subsection (1) or (2).
The Council must not appoint under subsection (4) a person who is the subject of an order made under section 18 or 18A.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may dissolve a committee established under subsection (1) or (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: not less than 18 members of the Council resolve that the committee should be dissolved.

subsection.content: On the dissolution of a committee under subsection (6), the Council may perform the functions of the committee.

section.name: s5AD
section.heading: Committees may establish subcommittees

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: A committee established under section 5AC may establish a subcommittee to perform any function of the committee.

Subject to subsection (3), the committee may appoint a member of the committee, or a person who is not a member of the committee, to be a member of a subcommittee established by the committee under subsection (1).
The committee must not appoint under subsection (2) a person who is the subject of an order made under section 18 or 18A.
The committee must not appoint a person who is not a member of the committee to be the chairperson of a subcommittee established by the committee under subsection (1).

section.name: s5AE
section.heading: Further provisions for committees and subcommittees

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: Schedule 9 has effect in relation to committees established under section 5AC and subcommittees established under section 5AD.

If a provision in this Part or Part 5, 6, 7, 8 or 9 or in regulations made under section 29(1C) concerning a committee or subcommittee (former provision) is inconsistent with a provision in Schedule 9 (latter provision), the former provision prevails over the latter provision with regard to the committee or subcommittee.

section.name: s5AF
section.heading: Application of provisions in Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance
section.leadIn: To the extent that it is consistent with this Ordinance, Part VII of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: committees established under section 5AC;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subcommittees established under section 5AD; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: appointments of members of such committees or subcommittees.

section.name: s5B
section.heading: Composition of Education and Accreditation Committee

subsection.leadIn: If the Council decides to establish the Education and Accreditation Committee under section 5AC(2)(a), it must appoint the following persons to be the members of the Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 3 members of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: 1 registered specialist dentist, who is not a member of the Council, nominated by the Council of the Academy of Medicine;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist, who is a public officer and is not a member of the Council, nominated by the Director of Health; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist, who is not a member of the Council, nominated by the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association.

subsection.content: The Council must appoint a member described in subsection (1)(a) as the chairperson of the Committee.
A member of the Committee holds office for 3 years and is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: A person ceases to be a member of the Committee if, during the term of the person’s office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(a)—the person ceases to be a member of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a member described in subsection (1)(b)—

subparagraph.content: the person ceases to be a registered dentist or ceases to be a full-time member of the teaching staff of the Faculty of Dentistry of the University of Hong Kong; or
the person becomes a member of the Council;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a member described in subsection (1)(c)—

subparagraph.content: the person ceases to be a registered specialist dentist; or
the person becomes a member of the Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a member described in subsection (1)(d)—

subparagraph.content: the person ceases to be a registered dentist or ceases to be a public officer; or
the person becomes a member of the Council; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for a member described in subsection (1)(e)—

subparagraph.content: the person ceases to be a registered dentist; or
the person becomes a member of the Council.

section.name: s5C
section.heading: Functions of Education and Accreditation Committee
section.leadIn: The Education and Accreditation Committee may perform the following functions— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 20)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Council the specialties under which the names of registered dentists may be included in the Specialist Register;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Council the qualifications, experience and other attributes that qualify a registered dentist to have his name included in the Specialist Register under a specialty recommended by the Committee under paragraph (a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to recommend to the Council the procedures and documentations for an application to include the name of a registered dentist in the Specialist Register;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Council so that it may decide whether the name of a registered dentist should be included in, or removed from, the Specialist Register;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to review and recommend to the Council the standard and structure of dental education and training in dentistry required for registration or practising dentistry; and (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 20)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to accredit a training programme and recommend to the Council as to whether the programme should be recognized for the purpose of registration or practising dentistry. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 20)

section.name: s5D
section.heading: Quorum of Education and Accreditation Committee’s meeting
section.content: At a meeting of the Education and Accreditation Committee, 4 members of the Committee (including the chairperson of the Committee) form a quorum.

section.name: s5F
section.heading: Proceedings of Education and Accreditation Committee
section.content: If a member of the Education and Accreditation Committee described in section 5B(1)(a) has taken part in dealing with any complaint or information involving a suitability issue, the member shall not, as a member of the Council, take part in the determination of the complaint or information by the Council.

section.name: s5H
section.heading: Composition of Examination Committee

subsection.leadIn: If the Council decides to establish the Examination Committee under section 5AC(2)(b), it must appoint the following persons to be the members of the Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 3 members of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: 2 registered specialist dentists nominated by the Council of the Academy of Medicine;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 2 registered dentists, who are public officers, nominated by the Director of Health;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 2 registered dentists nominated by the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist appointed by the Council to be responsible for conducting the Licensing Examination.

subsection.content: The Council must appoint a member described in subsection (1)(a) as the chairperson of the Committee.
A member of the Committee holds office for 3 years and is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: A person ceases to be a member of the Committee if, during the term of the person’s office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(a)—the person ceases to be a member of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(c)—the person ceases to be a registered specialist dentist;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(d)—the person ceases to be a registered dentist or ceases to be a public officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(e)—the person ceases to be a registered dentist; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(f)—the person ceases to be a registered dentist or ceases to be responsible for conducting the Licensing Examination.

section.name: s5I
section.heading: Functions of Examination Committee
section.leadIn: The Examination Committee may perform the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any function delegated to it under section 7B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to oversee matters relating to the setting of standards for the Licensing Examination;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to design the Licensing Examination; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: to make recommendations to the Council on the policies regarding—

subparagraph.content: the Licensing Examination;
the criteria for exemption from the Licensing Examination or any part of the Licensing Examination;
the extension of an internship period under section 8A(4)(a);
the shortening or extension of a period of assessment under section 8B(4)(a);
the termination of an internship under section 8A(5); and
the termination of a period of assessment under section 8B(5).

section.name: s5J
section.heading: Quorum of Examination Committee’s meeting
section.content: At a meeting of the Examination Committee, 4 members of the Committee (including the chairperson of the Committee) form a quorum.

section.name: s5K
section.heading: Composition of Continuing Professional Development Committee

subsection.leadIn: If the Council decides to establish the Continuing Professional Development Committee under section 5AC(2)(c), it must appoint the following persons to be the members of the Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 3 members of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: 1 registered specialist dentist nominated by the Council of the Academy of Medicine;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist, who is a public officer, nominated by the Director of Health; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 1 registered dentist nominated by the Council of the Hong Kong Dental Association.

subsection.content: The Council must appoint a member described in subsection (1)(a) as the chairperson of the Committee.
A member of the Committee holds office for 3 years and is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: A person ceases to be a member of the Committee if, during the term of the person’s office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(a)—the person ceases to be a member of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(c)—the person ceases to be a registered specialist dentist;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(d)—the person ceases to be a registered dentist or ceases to be a public officer; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(e)—the person ceases to be a registered dentist.

section.name: s5L
section.heading: Functions of Continuing Professional Development Committee

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

section.leadIn: The Continuing Professional Development Committee may perform the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Council on the policies regarding continuing professional development activities; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to make recommendations to the Council on the requirement regarding continuing professional development that a person must comply with for the purposes of section 11A(2A) or 15H(3).

section.name: s5M
section.heading: Quorum of Continuing Professional Development Committee’s meeting
section.content: At a meeting of the Continuing Professional Development Committee, 4 members of the Committee (including the chairperson of the Committee) form a quorum.

section.name: s5R
section.heading: Composition of Preliminary Investigation Committee

subsection.leadIn: If the Council decides to establish a Preliminary Investigation Committee under section 5AC(2)(e), it must appoint the following persons to be the members of the Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 member of the Council who is a registered dentist;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 registered dentists, who are not members of the Council, nominated by the Chairperson; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 2 members of the Council who are lay persons.

subsection.leadIn: The Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must appoint the member described in subsection (1)(a) as the chairperson of the Committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must appoint a member described in subsection (1)(b) as the deputy chairperson of the Committee.

subsection.content: A member of a Preliminary Investigation Committee holds office for a period not exceeding 3 years as specified by the Council in the member’s letter of appointment and is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: A person ceases to be a member of a Preliminary Investigation Committee if, during the term of the person’s office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(a)—the person ceases to be a member of the Council or ceases to be a registered dentist;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a member described in subsection (1)(b)—

subparagraph.content: the person ceases to be a registered dentist; or
the person becomes a member of the Council; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a member described in subsection (1)(c)—the person ceases to be a member of the Council or ceases to be a lay person.

section.name: s5S
section.heading: Functions of Preliminary Investigation Committee

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: A Preliminary Investigation Committee or any of its members may perform the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to—

subparagraph.content: make preliminary investigations into complaints or information concerning any matter that may be inquired into by the Council or any matter that the Health Committee may conduct a hearing on; and
give advice on the matter to any registrant concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to refer a matter to the Council for an inquiry mentioned in section 18;

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 26)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to refer a matter to the Education and Accreditation Committee to be dealt with in accordance with section 12F.

subsection.content: A Preliminary Investigation Committee and its members must act in accordance with regulations made under section 29(1C).

section.name: s5T
section.heading: Quorum of Preliminary Investigation Committee’s meeting

subsection.content: At a meeting of a Preliminary Investigation Committee, 3 members of the Committee form a quorum.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of a Preliminary Investigation Committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at least one member must be a member described in section 5R(1)(c);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least 2 members must be registered dentists; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (3) and (4), the chairperson of the Committee, or in the absence of the chairperson, the deputy chairperson of the Committee is to preside.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson and the deputy chairperson (if present at a meeting) declare their interest in accordance with regulations made under section 29(1C) in respect of a matter that is to be decided at the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: under the regulations, neither of them may preside at the meeting because of the interest.

subsection.content: The other members present at the meeting must elect one of them to preside at the meeting.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Registrar of Dentists

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, there shall be a Registrar of Dentists, who shall perform such functions in connection with the General Register, Specialist Register and Register of Dental Care Professionals as may be provided for under this Ordinance. (Amended 11 of 2006 s. 5)
The consultant dental surgeon in charge of the Dental Services of the Department of Health shall be the Registrar. (Amended 4 of 1988 s. 5; L.N. 76 of 1989)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Keeping of General Register and Specialist Register

subsection.content: The Registrar must cause a register of dentists, called the General Register, to be kept in a form that the Registrar thinks fit. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 30)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The General Register must be divided into 5 parts and contain the name, practice address (if any), registered address, qualification and any other particulars that the Registrar thinks necessary, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Part 1—every person whose name is required to be entered in this Part under section 9B;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in Part 2—every person whose name is required to be entered in this Part under section 7F;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in Part 3—every person whose name is required to be entered in this Part under section 9F;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in Part 4—every person whose name is required to be entered in this Part under section 9I; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in Part 5—every person whose name is required to be entered in this Part under section 9L. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 30)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Part 1 of the General Register must be further divided into—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the practising list; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the non-practising list. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 30)

subsection.content: The Registrar shall cause a register of specialist dentists, to be called the Specialist Register, to be kept in such form as he thinks fit. (Added 11 of 2006 s. 6)

The Specialist Register must contain the names, practice addresses (if any), registered addresses, qualifications, specialties and such other particulars as the Registrar thinks necessary of those registered dentists who have been approved by the Council to have their names included in the Register. (Added 11 of 2006 s. 6. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 30)
The Registrar is responsible for the maintenance and custody of the General Register and Specialist Register. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 30)

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Council to set Licensing Examination

subsection.content: The Council must set an examination called the Licensing Examination.

The Council may impose any condition relevant to the assessment or improvement of a person’s professional knowledge in dentistry that a person must satisfy before the Council allows the person to take the Licensing Examination or any part of the Licensing Examination.
The Council may refuse to allow a person to take the Licensing Examination if the person has, in any one part of the Licensing Examination, failed 5 times.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Eligibility for taking Licensing Examination

subsection.content: A person who wishes to take the Licensing Examination or any part of the Licensing Examination may make an application to the Council.
An application must be made in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may, on application, allow a person to take the Licensing Examination or the part of the Licensing Examination if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee has been paid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Council is satisfied that the person is of good character; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the condition imposed under section 7A(2) is satisfied.

subsection.content: The Council may delegate any of its functions under this section to the Examination Committee.

section.name: s7C
section.heading: Exemption from Licensing Examination

subsection.content: The Council may, on application made in the specified form, exempt a person from the Licensing Examination or any part of the Licensing Examination if it considers it appropriate to do so.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application is made for the purpose of seeking an exemption to satisfy a condition specified in Schedule 10 (as required under section 8(1)(c)(iii)); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is a person who has worked under full-time employment as a person with special registration in one or more Schedule 5 institutions (whether or not the person has also worked under full-time employment as a person with limited registration in one or more Schedule 4 institutions) (specified employment).

subsection.content: The Council must grant the exemption unless, having considered the nature and scope of the work undertaken by the person under the specified employment, the Council has reasonable doubts on the person’s professional knowledge on a matter that is the subject matter to be assessed by the Licensing Examination, or the part of the Licensing Examination for which the exemption is applied.

section.name: s7D
section.heading: Application for provisional registration

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Registrar for provisional registration.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be supported by a declaration by the applicant as to—

subparagraph.content: whether the applicant has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;
whether the applicant has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; and
whether, at the time of the application, the applicant is the subject of any criminal or disciplinary proceedings in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s7E
section.heading: Determination of application for provisional registration

subsection.content: On receiving an application made in accordance with section 7D, the Registrar must refer the application to the Council.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the Council must approve the application if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.content: has been awarded a qualifying degree in dentistry; and
has been engaged to work under full-time employment as a dentist in a Schedule 6 institution for the purpose of completing an internship mentioned in section 8A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.content: has passed the Licensing Examination; and
has been engaged to work under full-time employment as a dentist in a Schedule 7 institution for the purpose of completing a period of assessment mentioned in section 8B.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may reject the application if it is satisfied, after due inquiry, that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not of good character.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notification under subsection (4), the Registrar must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b)(i), a person who is exempted under section 7C from the Licensing Examination, or any part of the Licensing Examination, is to be regarded as having passed the Licensing Examination or the part of the Licensing Examination.

section.name: s7F
section.heading: Provisional registration

subsection.content: This section applies if the Council approves an application under section 7E.
The Registrar must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, enter the applicant’s name in Part 2 of the General Register.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person under this section is in force until the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the termination of the person’s employment mentioned in section 7E(2)(a)(ii) or (b)(ii);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the removal of the person’s name from Part 2 of the General Register under an order made under section 15, 18 or 18A.

section.name: s7G
section.heading: Effect of provisional registration
section.leadIn: A person with provisional registration is to be treated as a registered dentist—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person applying for provisional registration for the purpose of completing an internship mentioned in section 8A—while undertaking any work that the person is required to undertake for the purpose of completing the internship;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person applying for provisional registration for the purpose of completing a period of assessment mentioned in section 8B—while undertaking any work that the person is required to undertake for the purpose of completing the period of assessment; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for any other purpose as may be directed by the Chief Executive in Council.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Eligibility for full registration

subsection.leadIn: A person is eligible for full registration if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person has been awarded—

subparagraph.content: a qualifying degree in dentistry; and
a certificate of experience under section 8C;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: has passed the Licensing Examination; and
has been awarded a certificate of experience under section 8D; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: has worked under full-time employment as a person with limited registration in one or more Schedule 4 institutions or as a person with special registration in one or more Schedule 5 institutions for at least 5 years in aggregate;
is certified by the institution, or by all the institutions, to have satisfactorily served as a dentist during the employment period by reference to the criteria specified by the Council; and
satisfies the condition specified in Schedule 10.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(i), a person who is exempted under section 7C from the Licensing Examination, or any part of the Licensing Examination, is to be regarded as having passed the Licensing Examination or the part of the Licensing Examination.

section.name: s8A
section.heading: Internship

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been awarded a qualifying degree in dentistry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wishes to be awarded a certificate of experience under section 8C.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first day and the last day of a period (internship period) during which the person is required to undergo an internship in a Schedule 6 institution for the purpose of being awarded a certificate of experience under section 8C; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scope of work that the person must undertake during the internship period for that purpose.

subsection.content: The duration of the internship period must be the same as that specified in Part 1 of Schedule 8.

subsection.leadIn: The Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: despite subsection (3), may extend the internship period specified for the person if the Council considers it appropriate to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may defer the dates specified under subsection (2)(a).

subsection.content: If the Council reasonably determines that a person undergoing an internship is unlikely to attain the professional standards required of a registered dentist at the end of the internship, the Council may terminate the internship.

section.name: s8B
section.heading: Period of assessment

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has not been awarded a qualifying degree in dentistry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has passed the Licensing Examination; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: wishes to be awarded a certificate of experience under section 8D.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the first day and the last day of a period (period of assessment) during which the person is required to undergo assessment in a Schedule 7 institution for the purpose of being awarded a certificate of experience under section 8D; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the scope of work that the person must undertake during the period of assessment for that purpose.

subsection.content: The duration of the period of assessment must not exceed that specified in Part 2 of Schedule 8.

subsection.leadIn: The Council—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: may defer the dates specified under subsection (2)(a).

subsection.content: If the Council reasonably determines that a person undergoing a period of assessment is unlikely to attain the professional standards required of a registered dentist at the end of the period of assessment, the Council may terminate the period of assessment.

For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a person who is exempted under section 7C from the Licensing Examination, or any part of the Licensing Examination, is to be regarded as having passed the Licensing Examination or the part of the Licensing Examination.

section.name: s8C
section.heading: Certificate of experience on completion of internship

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a person who has completed an internship mentioned in section 8A.
The person may apply to the specified authority for a certificate of experience.

subsection.leadIn: The specified authority may award the certificate to the person if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the internship, the person undertook work within the scope of work specified under section 8A(2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the work of the person was satisfactory.

subsection.content: The certificate must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Council has not delegated its functions under section 8E(1)—the Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Council has delegated its functions under section 8E(1) to an institution—the institution.

section.name: s8D
section.heading: Certificate of experience on completion of period of assessment

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a person who has completed a period of assessment mentioned in section 8B.
The person may apply to the specified authority for a certificate of experience.

subsection.leadIn: The specified authority may award the certificate to the person if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: during the period of assessment, the person undertook work within the scope of work specified under section 8B(2)(b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the work of the person was satisfactory.

subsection.content: The certificate must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the Council has not delegated its functions under section 8E(2)—the Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Council has delegated its functions under section 8E(2) to an institution—the institution.

section.name: s8E
section.heading: Council may delegate its functions under sections 8C and 8D

subsection.leadIn: The Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, delegate its functions under section 8C in respect of a person who has been awarded a qualifying degree in dentistry by a university to any of the following institutions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the university; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Schedule 6 institution.

subsection.content: The Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, delegate its functions under section 8D in respect of a person to a Schedule 7 institution.
A notice published under subsection (1) or (2) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Application for full registration

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Registrar for full registration.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: be supported by a declaration by the applicant as to—

subparagraph.content: whether the applicant has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;
whether the applicant has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; and
whether, at the time of the application, the applicant is the subject of any criminal or disciplinary proceedings in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s9A
section.heading: Determination of application for full registration

subsection.content: On receiving an application made in accordance with section 9, the Registrar must refer the application to the Council.
Subject to subsection (3), the Council must approve the application if the applicant is eligible for full registration in accordance with section 8.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may reject the application if it is satisfied, after due inquiry, that the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is not of good character.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notification under subsection (4), the Registrar must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

section.name: s9B
section.heading: Full registration

subsection.content: This section applies if the Council approves an application under section 9A.
The Registrar must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, enter the applicant’s name in Part 1 of the General Register.
The Registrar must enter the applicant’s name in the practising list or the non-practising list according to the wish indicated under section 9(2)(b).

section.name: s9C
section.heading: Application for limited registration

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Registrar for limited registration.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be supported by a declaration by the applicant as to—

subparagraph.content: whether the applicant has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;
whether the applicant has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; and
whether, at the time of the application, the applicant is the subject of any criminal or disciplinary proceedings in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s9D
section.heading: Determination of application for limited registration

subsection.content: On receiving an application made in accordance with section 9C, the Registrar must refer the application to the Council.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must approve the application if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant has been selected for—

subparagraph.content: full-time employment as a person with limited registration in a Schedule 4 institution; or
an employment or an employment of a type determined under section 9E;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has obtained a recognized non-Hong Kong qualification;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant has had adequate and relevant full-time post-qualification clinical experience;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: unless the applicant is a person with limited registration or a person with special registration when the application is made, or was such a person at any time before the application is made—the applicant is registered as a dentist under the law of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the applicant has not been refused, under section 7A(3), to take the Licensing Examination; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the applicant is of good character.

subsection.leadIn: In approving an application, the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify a period not exceeding 3 years during which the registration is to be in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose any condition that the Council considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notification under subsection (4), the Registrar must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: recognized non-Hong Kong qualification (認可境外資格) means a qualification obtained outside Hong Kong that is recognized by the Council for the purposes of this section as being sufficient evidence of the possession of the requisite knowledge and skill for the effective practice of dentistry.

section.name: s9E
section.heading: Promulgation of employment for section 9D(2)(a)(ii)

subsection.content: The Council may, having regard to any representations made to it, determine for the purposes of section 9D(2)(a)(ii) an employment or a type of employment in respect of which limited registration is appropriate or necessary.
The Council must promulgate the determination by notice published in the Gazette.
A notice published under subsection (2) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s9F
section.heading: Limited registration

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: This section applies if the Council approves an application under section 9D.
The Registrar must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, enter the applicant’s name in Part 3 of the General Register.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person under this section is in force until the earliest of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period during which the registration is in force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the termination of the person’s employment mentioned in section 9D(2)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the removal of the person’s name from Part 3 of the General Register under an order made under section 15, 18 or 18A.

section.name: s9G
section.heading: Application for temporary registration

subsection.content: A person (applicant) may apply to the Council for the temporary registration of another person (subject person) exclusively for conducting clinical teaching or research for the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be supported by a declaration by the subject person as to—

subparagraph.content: whether the subject person has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;
whether the subject person has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; and
whether, at the time of the application, the subject person is the subject of any criminal or disciplinary proceedings in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s9H
section.heading: Determination of application for temporary registration

subsection.content: On receiving an application made in accordance with section 9G for the temporary registration of a person, the Council may approve or reject it.

However, the Council must not approve an application unless the Council is satisfied that it is appropriate and necessary for the person to be granted temporary registration to enable the person to conduct clinical teaching or research for the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: In approving an application, the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify a period not exceeding 14 days during which the registration is to be in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose any condition that the Council considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.content: If the Council approves an application, the Council must also notify the Registrar of the decision.

section.name: s9I
section.heading: Temporary registration

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: This section applies if the Council approves, under section 9H, an application for the temporary registration of a person.
The Registrar must enter the name of the person in Part 4 of the General Register.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person under this section is in force until the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period during which the registration is in force;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the Council’s receipt of the applicant’s written notification for the termination of the registration.

section.name: s9J
section.heading: Application for special registration

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Registrar for special registration.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: be supported by a declaration by the applicant as to—

subparagraph.content: whether the applicant has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment;
whether the applicant has been found guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct; and
whether, at the time of the application, the applicant is the subject of any criminal or disciplinary proceedings in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s9K
section.heading: Determination of application for special registration

subsection.content: On receiving an application made in accordance with section 9J, the Registrar must refer the application to the Council.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must approve the application if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant has been selected for full-time employment as a person with special registration in a Schedule 5 institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has obtained a recognized non-Hong Kong qualification;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the applicant has been awarded a Fellowship of the Academy of Medicine in the specialty of dental surgery; or

the Academy of Medicine has certified that the applicant has attained a professional standard equivalent to that recognized by the Academy for the award of a Fellowship of the Academy in the specialty of dental surgery;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant has had adequate and relevant full-time post-qualification clinical experience;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: unless the applicant is a person with limited registration or a person with special registration when the application is made, or was such a person at any time before the application is made—the applicant is registered as a dentist under the law of a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the applicant has not been refused, under section 7A(3), to take the Licensing Examination; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the applicant is of good character.

subsection.leadIn: In approving an application, the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must specify a period not exceeding 3 years during which the registration is to be in force; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose any condition that the Council considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notification under subsection (4), the Registrar must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: recognized non-Hong Kong qualification (認可境外資格) means a qualification obtained outside Hong Kong that is recognized by the Council for the purposes of this section as being sufficient evidence of the possession of the requisite knowledge and skill for the effective practice of dentistry.

section.name: s9L
section.heading: Special registration

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: This section applies if the Council approves an application under section 9K.
The Registrar must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, enter the applicant’s name in Part 5 of the General Register.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a person under this section is in force until the earliest of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period during which the registration is in force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the termination of the person’s employment mentioned in section 9K(2)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the removal of the person’s name from Part 5 of the General Register under an order made under section 15, 18 or 18A.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Certificate of Registration and Practising Certificate

section.name: s10
section.heading: Certificate of registration
section.content: If the name of a person is entered in Part 1, 3 or 5 of the General Register under section 9B, 9F or 9L, the Registrar must issue to the person a certificate of registration in the specified form.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Privileges of registered dentists

subsection.content: Subject to section 11A(7), every registered dentist shall be entitled to recover in due course of law reasonable charges for professional aid, advice and visits and the value of any medicine or any dental or medical appliances rendered, made or supplied by him to his patients. (Amended 49 of 1977 s. 5)
No person shall be entitled to recover in any court any such charges as are referred to in subsection (1) unless at the date when such charges accrued he was a registered dentist.

section.name: s11A
section.heading: Practising certificate required for practice

subsection.content: A registered dentist must not practise as a dentist in Hong Kong unless the registered dentist holds a valid practising certificate. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: The Council may issue a practising certificate in the specified form to a registered dentist (applicant) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant applies to the Council for a practising certificate;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the application is supported by a declaration by the applicant as to whether the applicant has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an offence punishable with imprisonment, and if the applicant has been so convicted, giving details of the conviction; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee has been paid. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If the applicant for a practising certificate is a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration, the Council must not issue a practising certificate to the applicant unless the Council is satisfied that the applicant has complied with the requirement regarding continuing professional development determined by the Council as applicable to the applicant. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 39)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.content: The Council may specify in a practising certificate any condition that the Council considers appropriate. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 39)

If a practising certificate is issued on an application made during a year in respect of that year, the certificate is, subject to subsections (4A) and (5), to be in force from the time of issue to the end of that year. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 39)

If a practising certificate is issued on an application made during a year in respect of the following year, the certificate is, subject to subsections (4A) and (5), to be in force during that following year. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.content: A practising certificate issued to a person with temporary registration is, subject to subsection (5), to be in force during a period not exceeding 14 days, as specified in the certificate. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.leadIn: A practising certificate issued under this section ceases to be in force if, during the currency of the certificate, its holder ceases to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person with full registration whose name is contained in the practising list;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person with limited registration;

paragraph.name: c
