paragraph.content: a person with temporary registration; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person with special registration. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 39)

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 11(1) a person who is required under this section to be the holder of a practising certificate shall not be entitled to recover any fees, costs or other remuneration on any cause of action unless he was, at the time when the cause of action arose, the holder of a valid practising certificate.

section.name: s12A
section.heading: Qualification for inclusion in Specialist Register
section.content: The Council may approve the qualifications, experience and other attributes recommended by the Education and Accreditation Committee that qualify a registered dentist to have his name included in the Specialist Register under a specialty.

section.name: s12B
section.heading: Application for inclusion in Specialist Register

subsection.content: A registered dentist who wishes to have his name included in the Specialist Register under a specialty may apply to the Council for the inclusion in the specified form. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 43)
The Council shall not approve a registered dentist’s application made under subsection (1) unless, in the Council’s opinion, the dentist satisfies the conditions in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: Those conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the dentist—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: awarded a Fellowship of the Academy of Medicine in the specialty of dental surgery; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: certified by the Academy that he has completed the postgraduate dental training, and has satisfied the continuing education requirements, determined by the Academy for the specialty; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: has been certified by the Academy of Medicine that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he has achieved a professional standard equivalent to that recognized by the Academy for the award of a Fellowship of the Academy of Medicine in the specialty of dental surgery; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: he has completed the postgraduate dental training, and has satisfied the continuing education requirements, comparable to those determined by the Academy for the specialty; and (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 43)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the dentist is competent in the specialty.

subsection.content: On receiving a registered dentist’s application made under subsection (1), the Council shall refer the application to the Education and Accreditation Committee for a recommendation as to whether the dentist satisfies the conditions in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after having received a referral under subsection (4), the Education and Accreditation Committee shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the Council of its recommendation and the reasons for it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case where the Committee recommends to the Council that the registered dentist does not satisfy the conditions in subsection (3), notify the dentist in writing of its recommendation and the reasons for it.

subsection.content: In making the recommendation referred to in subsection (4), the Education and Accreditation Committee shall take into account any recommendation made by the Committee under section 12F(1)(d).

Within 14 days after having received a notice under subsection (5)(b), the registered dentist may submit to the Council representations in writing on the Education and Accreditation Committee’s recommendation.

subsection.leadIn: If the Education and Accreditation Committee recommends to the Council that a registered dentist does not satisfy the conditions in subsection (3), the Council shall not decide whether or not to approve the application until the later of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period within which the dentist may submit representations under subsection (7); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry of the period within which the dentist may request the Committee to review its recommendation under section 12F(5).

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether or not to approve a registered dentist’s application made under subsection (1), the Council shall have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Education and Accreditation Committee’s recommendation referred to in subsection (4) and the reasons for it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the dentist has submitted representations under subsection (7), those representations; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the dentist has requested the Committee to review its recommendation under section 12F(5), the result of the review and the reasons for it.

subsection.leadIn: If the Council approves the application of a registered dentist made under subsection (1), the Council must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, direct the Registrar— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 43)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to include the dentist’s name in the Specialist Register under the specialty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to issue a certificate, in the specified form, to the effect that the dentist’s name has been included in the Specialist Register under the specialty. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 43)

subsection.content: If the Council rejects the application of the registered dentist, the Council shall notify the dentist in writing of the rejection and the reasons for it.

section.name: s12C
section.heading: Title of specialist, etc.
section.leadIn: A registered dentist whose name is included in the Specialist Register under a specialty is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be known in such specialist title in both the English language and Chinese language as may be determined by the Council for that specialty; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to such other entitlements as may be determined by the Council.

section.name: s12D
section.heading: Continuing education for dentists included in Specialist Register
section.content: A registered dentist whose name is included in the Specialist Register under a specialty shall undergo such continuing education as may be determined from time to time by the Academy of Medicine for the specialty.

section.name: s12E
section.heading: Receipt of complaint or information on suitability issue

subsection.content: Where the Secretary receives a complaint or information involving a suitability issue, he shall submit the complaint or information to a Preliminary Investigation Committee. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 44)

As soon as practicable after a complaint or information has been submitted to a Preliminary Investigation Committee under subsection (1), the chairperson of the Committee must ascertain whether it also falls within regulation 13 of the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A). (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 44)

subsection.leadIn: If the chairperson of a Preliminary Investigation Committee is of the opinion that the complaint or information also falls within regulation 13 of the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A), the complaint or information shall— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 44)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be referred to the Secretary to be dealt with in accordance with those regulations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after having been dealt with under those regulations, be referred to the Education and Accreditation Committee to be dealt with in accordance with section 12F.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the complaint or information shall be referred to the Education and Accreditation Committee to be dealt with in accordance with section 12F.

section.name: s12F
section.heading: Complaints or information referred to Education and Accreditation Committee

subsection.leadIn: Where a complaint or information in respect of a registered dentist is referred to the Education and Accreditation Committee, the Committee, after considering all the circumstances of the case, may, with or without inviting the dentist to make representations under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: dismiss the matter;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the complaint or information also falls within regulation 13 of the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A), refer it to the Secretary to be dealt with in accordance with those regulations;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the dentist’s name is included in the Specialist Register, recommend to the Council that the name be removed from the Specialist Register, or be removed from the Register for such period or until the occurrence of such event as the Committee recommends; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: where the dentist is applying for the inclusion of his name in the Specialist Register, recommend to the Council that the dentist does not satisfy the conditions in section 12B(3).

subsection.content: The Education and Accreditation Committee shall not deal with a complaint or information referred to it if the chairperson of the Committee is of the opinion that the complaint or information is frivolous or groundless and should not proceed further. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 45)

In dealing with such a complaint or information in respect of a registered dentist, the Education and Accreditation Committee may invite the dentist to make representations in person before the Committee or submit to the Committee representations in writing.

If the Education and Accreditation Committee makes a recommendation under subsection (1)(c) or (d), the Committee shall notify the registered dentist concerned in writing of the recommendation and the reasons for it.

Within 14 days after having received a notice under subsection (4), the registered dentist may request, in writing and setting out the reasons relied upon, the Education and Accreditation Committee to review its recommendation.

As soon as practicable after having received a request under subsection (5), the Education and Accreditation Committee shall notify the registered dentist in writing of the result of the review and the reasons for it.

If a registered dentist has requested the Education and Accreditation Committee to review its recommendation under subsection (1)(c), the dentist may, within 14 days after having received a notice under subsection (6), submit to the Council representations in writing on the result of the review.

section.name: s12G
section.heading: Registered dentists and persons with provisional registration must provide address

subsection.content: A registered dentist or a person with provisional registration must provide to the Registrar an address in Hong Kong at which he or she may be contacted.

Subject to subsection (3), a registered dentist (other than a registered dentist whose name is contained in the non-practising list) must provide to the Registrar the address of all premises in Hong Kong on which he or she carries on the practice of dentistry.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not require a person to provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an address of—

subparagraph.content: any premises on which the person provides an outreach medical service (within the meaning of section 9 of the Private Healthcare Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 633)); or
any premises on which the person carries on the practice of dentistry not for gain; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an address of any premises of a class specified under subsection (4).

subsection.content: The Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify any class of premises for the purposes of subsection (3)(b).

A person who has provided an address under subsection (1) or (2) must report to the Registrar any change of the address (including the address as changed and reported under this subsection) within 2 months after the date on which the change occurs.
A person who fails to comply with subsection (1), (2) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 1.

If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (6), it is a defence for the person to establish that the person had a reasonable excuse for the failure to comply with subsection (1), (2) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under subsection (6) is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for a defence under subsection (7) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s12H
section.heading: Transfer from practising list to non-practising list

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose name is contained in the practising list; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who wishes to have the person’s name contained in the non-practising list.

subsection.content: The person may apply to the Registrar in the specified form for the transfer of the person’s name from the practising list to the non-practising list.

On receiving an application made in accordance with subsection (2), the Registrar must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, alter the General Register by transferring the person’s name from the practising list to the non-practising list.

section.name: s12I
section.heading: Issue of retention certificate to person whose name is contained in non-practising list

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose name is contained in the non-practising list.
The person may apply to the Council in the specified form for a retention certificate.
On receiving an application made in accordance with subsection (2), the Council must, after the prescribed fee has been paid, issue to the person a retention certificate.
The Council may specify in a retention certificate any condition that the Council considers appropriate.

If a retention certificate is issued on an application made during a year in respect of a period beginning in that year, the certificate is, subject to subsection (7), to be in force from the time of issue until the end of 2 years immediately following that year.

If a retention certificate is issued on an application made during a year in respect of a period beginning in the following year, the certificate is, subject to subsection (7), to be in force for 3 years beginning on the first day of that following year.

subsection.leadIn: A retention certificate ceases to be in force if, during the currency of the certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its holder ceases to be a person with full registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar cancels the certificate under section 12J(5).

section.name: s12J
section.heading: Transfer from non-practising list to practising list

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose name is contained in the non-practising list; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who wishes to have the person’s name contained in the practising list.

subsection.content: The person may apply to the Registrar for the transfer of the person’s name from the non-practising list to the practising list.

subsection.leadIn: An application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made at the same time an application for a practising certificate mentioned in section 11A(2) is made.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application made in accordance with subsection (3), the Registrar must alter the General Register by transferring the person’s name from the non-practising list to the practising list if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prescribed fee has been paid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the condition (if any) specified under section 12I(4) has not been contravened; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a practising certificate has been issued to the person under section 11A(2).

subsection.content: On the transfer of the person’s name, the Registrar must cancel the retention certificate issued to the person that is still in force.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Publication of information in General Register and evidence of registration

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after 1 January of every year, the Registrar must prepare and publish in the Gazette a list of the name, practice address (if any), qualification, date of qualification, and other particulars that the Registrar considers appropriate, of every person who is a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration on 1 January of the year.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after 1 July of every year, the Registrar must prepare and publish in the Gazette a list of the name, practice address (if any), qualification, date of qualification, and other particulars that the Registrar considers appropriate, of every person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration on 1 July of the year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose name was entered in Part 1, 3 or 5 of the General Register between 1 January and 1 July (both dates inclusive) of the year.

subsection.content: A person’s name being contained in a list published under subsection (1) or (2) is prima facie evidence that the person is a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration (as the case requires).

The absence of a person’s name from the list last published under subsection (1) and from any list subsequently published under subsection (2) is prima facie evidence that the person is not a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration (as the case requires).
A certificate issued by the Registrar stating that a person’s name is or is not, or was or was not, contained in the General Register on a date is conclusive evidence of that fact.

section.name: s13A
section.heading: Publication of information in Specialist Register and evidence of inclusion

subsection.content: As soon as practicable after 1 January of every year, the Registrar must prepare and publish in the Gazette a list of the name, practice address (if any), qualification, date of qualification, and other particulars that the Registrar considers appropriate, of every person who is a registered specialist dentist on 1 January of the year.

subsection.leadIn: As soon as practicable after 1 July of every year, the Registrar must prepare and publish in the Gazette a list of the name, practice address (if any), qualification, date of qualification, and other particulars that the Registrar considers appropriate, of every person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is a registered specialist dentist on 1 July of the year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose name was included in the Specialist Register between 1 January and 1 July (both dates inclusive) of the year.

subsection.content: A person’s name being contained in a list published under subsection (1) or (2) is prima facie evidence that the person is a registered specialist dentist.

The absence of a person’s name from the list last published under subsection (1) and from any list subsequently published under subsection (2) is prima facie evidence that the person is not a registered specialist dentist.
A certificate issued by the Registrar stating that a person’s name is or is not, or was or was not, contained in the Specialist Register on a date is conclusive evidence of that fact.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Alterations to General Register and Specialist Register

subsection.content: If a change of or an addition to the practice address, or a change of the registered address, of a person whose name is contained in the General Register has come to the Registrar’s knowledge, the Registrar must alter the General Register to reflect the change or addition. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: If a change of or an addition to the practice address, or a change of the registered address, of a person whose name is contained in the Specialist Register has come to the Registrar’s knowledge, the Registrar must alter the Specialist Register to reflect the change or addition. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The Registrar may, after the prescribed fee has been paid by a person whose name is contained in the General Register or Specialist Register, alter the entry in the Register relating to the person (other than an alteration relating to the practice address or registered address of the person). (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)
The Registrar must make an alteration to the General Register or Specialist Register that is made necessary by any decision of the Council. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: The Council may order the removal from the General Register of the name of a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is deceased;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who, being a person with full registration, a person with limited registration or a person with special registration, has failed to obtain a certificate specified in subsection (4) (specified certificate) within 6 months after the last of the following dates (if applicable)—

subparagraph.content: the date of the person’s registration;
the expiry date of the last specified certificate issued to the person;
the date on which the person’s name is restored to the General Register under section 27A; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: who has not provided to the Registrar an address at which the person may be contacted. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: A certificate specified for subsection (3)(b) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a person with full registration—

subparagraph.content: a practising certificate issued under section 11A; or
a retention certificate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a person with limited registration or a person with special registration, a practising certificate issued under section 11A. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (3) must be signed by the Registrar. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (7) and (8), the Registrar may remove from the General Register the name of a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whose name is ordered to be removed under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whose registration under this Part is no longer in force. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.content: The Registrar must cause a copy of an order made under subsection (3)(b) or (c) in respect of a person to be served on the person as soon as practicable after it is made. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not remove the name of a person from the General Register in accordance with an order made under subsection (3) before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the order is made under subsection (3)(b) or (c)—subject to paragraph (b), the expiry of 1 month after the date on which a copy of the order is served under subsection (7); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal is made against the order under section 23—the appeal is finally determined. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(c), a person is to be regarded as not having provided an address to the Registrar if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered letter is sent to the person at the last registered address provided by the person to the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person fails to acknowledge receipt of the letter within 12 months after the date on which the letter is sent. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 51)

section.name: s15A
section.heading: Removal of names from Specialist Register

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council orders a removal of the name of a registered dentist from the General Register under section 15(3), 18 or 18A; and (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 52)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the dentist’s name is also included in the Specialist Register,

subsection.continued: the Registrar shall, at the same time when he removes the dentist’s name from the General Register, also remove the dentist’s name from the Specialist Register.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), the Council may order that the name of a registered dentist be removed from the Specialist Register, or be removed from the Register for such period or until the occurrence of such event as the Council specifies.

subsection.leadIn: In deciding whether or not to order the removal of the registered dentist’s name from the Specialist Register, the Council shall have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Education and Accreditation Committee’s recommendation under section 12F(1)(c) and the reasons for it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the dentist has requested the Committee to review that recommendation under section 12F(5), the result of the review and the reasons for it; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the dentist has submitted representations under section 12F(7), those representations.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (2) must be signed by the Registrar. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 52)

Subject to subsections (6) and (7), the Registrar may remove from the Specialist Register the name of a registered dentist whose name is ordered to be removed under subsection (2). (Added 22 of 2024 s. 52)

The Registrar must cause a copy of an order made under subsection (2) in respect of a registered dentist to be served on the registered dentist as soon as practicable after it is made. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 52)

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not remove the name of a registered dentist from the Specialist Register in accordance with an order made under subsection (2) before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the expiry of 1 month after the date on which a copy of the order is served under subsection (6); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal is made against the order under section 23—the appeal is finally determined. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 52)

section.name: s16
section.heading: Inspection of premises used for the practice of dentistry

subsection.content: A public officer may, with the written authorization of the Council, exercise any or all of the powers specified in subsection (1A), for the purpose of conducting an investigation as to whether a person has done, is doing or is about to do an act that may render the person liable to an inquiry mentioned in section 18. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 56)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The powers are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter any premises used or proposed to be used for the practice of dentistry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after entering the premises—

subparagraph.content: to inspect the premises;
to observe any procedure or test carried out on the premises;
to take any photograph and video recording on the premises;

to do anything necessary for ascertaining whether a person has done, is doing or is about to do an act that may render the person liable to an inquiry mentioned in section 18. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 56)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The public officer must, if requested, produce the Council’s authorization for inspection. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 56)

Any person wilfully obstructing or resisting an officer duly authorized by the Council in the exercise of a power specified in subsection (1A) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 1. (Amended 68 of 1986 s. 13; E.R. 7 of 2020; 22 of 2024 s. 56)
For the purposes of subsections (1) and (1A), a reference to an act includes an omission. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 56)

section.name: s17
section.heading: Premises unsuitable for the practice of dentistry
section.content: A registrant must not practise dentistry on premises or under conditions which are unsuitable for such practice.

part.name: P14
part.heading: Matters relating to Inquiry or Hearing by Council or Health Committee

section.name: s18
section.heading: Disciplinary inquiries by the Council

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, after due inquiry into a case referred to it by a Preliminary Investigation Committee in accordance with regulations made under section 29, the Council is satisfied that a registrant— (Amended 12 of 1968 s. 4; 22 of 2024 s. 59)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of any offence punishable with imprisonment; (Amended 79 of 1984 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been guilty in Hong Kong or elsewhere of unprofessional conduct;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has obtained registration by fraud or misrepresentation;

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: has procured his name to be included in the Specialist Register by fraud or misrepresentation; (Added 11 of 2006 s. 16)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: was not at the time of registration eligible to be registered;

paragraph.name: e

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 59)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: has contravened any condition imposed under section 9D, 9H, 9K or 15E, or specified under section 11A or 15H; or (Added 22 of 2024 s. 59)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: has contravened any provision in a code of practice issued under section 27B. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 59)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: The Council may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the registrant is a registered dentist or a person with provisional registration—

subparagraph.content: order the name of the registrant to be removed from the General Register permanently; or

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 59)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: order the registrant to be reprimanded; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: make any other order that it considers appropriate, but no such order may be of greater severity than that mentioned in paragraph (a), (b) or (c). (Added 22 of 2024 s. 59)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 59)

subsection.name: 1AAC
subsection.leadIn: The Council may also make any order that the Council considers appropriate with regard to the payment of the costs of any one or more of the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the complainant;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a solicitor or counsel present at the inquiry;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registrant. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 59)

subsection.name: 1AAD
subsection.content: Any costs awarded under subsection (1AAC) may be recovered summarily as a civil debt in accordance with the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227). (Added 22 of 2024 s. 59)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The Council may, in making any of the orders referred to in subsection (1AA)(a), (b) and (c), order that the operation of such order be suspended so that it shall not take effect unless, during a period or periods specified in the suspending order in aggregate not exceeding 3 years, a finding is made against the registrant under subsection (1) or the registrant is found by the Council to be in breach of any condition imposed by the Council at the time of making the suspending order. (Added 16 of 1992 s. 2)

Nothing in this section shall be deemed to require the Council to inquire into the question whether the registrant was properly convicted but the Council may consider any record of the case in which such conviction was recorded and any other evidence which may be available and is relevant as showing the nature and gravity of the offence.

Within 1 month after the expiry of the time within which an appeal against an order made by the Council under subsection (1AA) or (1AAC) may be made to the Court of Appeal under section 23, or if such appeal has been made, within 1 month after the appeal is finally determined, the Council must, in the case of an order made under subsection (1AA)(a), (b) or (c), and may, in the case of an order made under subsection (1AA)(d), cause the order or, if the order is varied on appeal, the order as so varied to be published in the Gazette. (Amended 16 of 1992 s. 2; 10 of 2005 s. 55)

subsection.leadIn: Where any order is published in the Gazette pursuant to subsection (5), the Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall publish with the order—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: sufficient particulars to acquaint the public with the nature of the matter to which the order relates; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may publish with the order an account of the proceedings at the inquiry at which the order was made. (Added 16 of 1992 s. 2)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Powers of Council with regard to obtaining evidence and the conduct of proceedings

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an inquiry mentioned in section 7E, 9A, 15E or 18, the Council has the following powers— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 61)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to hear, receive and examine evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to summon any person to attend the inquiry to give evidence or produce any document or other thing in his possession and to examine him as a witness or require him to produce any document or other thing in his possession, subject to all just exceptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to admit or exclude the public or any member of the public from the inquiry;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to admit or exclude the press from the inquiry;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to award any person summoned to attend the inquiry such sum or sums as in the opinion of the Council may have been reasonably expended by him by reason of his attendance.

subsection.leadIn: Summonses to witnesses must be signed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an inquiry by the Council—the Chairperson; or (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 61)

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 61)

subsection.content: If it appears to the Council or Health Committee that it is necessary to do so in the interest of the complainant, the registrant concerned or any witness concerned, the Council or Health Committee may order that all or any information relating to the hearing must not be disclosed. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 61)

A person who fails to comply with an order made under subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 61)

section.name: s20
section.heading: Penalty for failure to give evidence

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

section.leadIn: Any person who being summoned to attend as a witness or produce a book, document or any other thing at any inquiry mentioned in section 7E, 9A, 15E or 18 refuses or neglects to do so or to answer any question put to him by or with the concurrence of the Council commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months: (Amended 68 of 1986 s. 14; 80 of 1997 s. 91; 22 of 2024 s. 62)
section.proviso: Provided that no person shall be bound to incriminate himself and every witness shall, in respect of any evidence given by him before the Council, be entitled to the same privileges to which he would be entitled if giving evidence before a court of justice.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Appearance of solicitor or counsel

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendment made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.content: The complainant in any inquiry mentioned in section 7E, 9A, 15E or 18 and the person whose conduct is the subject of such inquiry shall be entitled to be represented by a solicitor or counsel throughout the inquiry. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 63)

section.name: s22
section.heading: Provisions for Council’s orders under sections 18 and 18A

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar may remove from the General Register or Register of Dental Care Professionals the name of a registrant whose name is ordered to be removed under section 18 or 18A. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 64)
The Registrar must cause a copy of an order made under section 18 or 18A in respect a registrant to be served on the registrant as soon as practicable after it is made. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 64)

subsection.leadIn: Unless an order is made under section 18A(2)(d), the Registrar must not remove the name of a registrant from the General Register or Register of Dental Care Professionals in accordance with an order made under section 18 or 18A before—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), the expiry of 1 month after the date on which a copy of the order is served under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal is made against the order under section 23—the appeal is finally determined. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 64)

subsection.content: Any order made by the Council under section 18 or 18A must be signed by the Registrar. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 64)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Appeals

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: The following person may appeal to the Court of Appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person whose application for registration is rejected by the Council under section 7E, 9A, 9D, 9H, 9K or 15E; (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a person who is aggrieved by an order made in respect of him or her under section 15, 15A(2), 15K, 18 or 18A; (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person whose application for a practising certificate is rejected under section 11A or 15H; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who is aggrieved by the Council’s decision to impose a condition under section 9D, 9H, 9K or 15E; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a person whose application for restoration is rejected by the Council under section 27A, (Added 22 of 2024 s. 66)

subsection.continued: and the Court of Appeal may affirm, reverse or vary the order or decision appealed against and may exercise any power that the Council may exercise. (Replaced 11 of 2006 s. 18. Amended 22 of 2024 s. 66)

subsection.content: The practice in relation to any such appeal shall be subject to any rules of court made under the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4). (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 11 of 2006 s. 18)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (3), the Court of Appeal has no power to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hear any appeal against an order made under section 15, 15A(2), 15K, 18 or 18A unless notice of the appeal was given within 1 month of the order being served in accordance with section 15(7), 15A(6), 15K(8) or 22(2) (if service of a copy of the order is required under that section); (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: hear an appeal against a decision made under section 7E, 9A, 9D, 9H, 9K, 15E or 27A to reject an application unless notice of the appeal was given within 1 month after the notice of the decision was given under that section; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.content: hear an appeal against a decision to impose a condition under section 9D, 9H, 9K or 15E unless notice of the appeal was given within 1 month after the notice of the decision was given under that section; and (Added 22 of 2024 s. 66)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hear any appeal against a decision made by the Council to reject an application under section 12B(1) unless notice of the appeal was given within 1 month of the notice of the rejection being given under section 12B(11). (Added 11 of 2006 s. 18)

subsection.content: In deciding any appeal under this section the Court of Appeal may make such order for costs as it considers reasonable. (Added 49 of 1977 s. 9)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Penalty for fraudulent registration, etc.
section.leadIn: Any person who fraudulently procures or attempts to procure—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: himself or any other person to be registered under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: his or any other person’s name to be included in the Specialist Register,

section.continued: by making or producing, or causing to be made or produced, any false or fraudulent representation or declaration, either orally or in writing, commits an offence and is liable on conviction upon indictment to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Penalty for falsely pretending to be or taking or using the name or title of a dentist

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1A), a person commits an offence if— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 68)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person is not any of the following—

subparagraph.content: a registered dentist;
a person deemed to be a registered dentist under this Ordinance;
a person with provisional registration; and (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 68)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person wilfully or falsely— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 68)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pretends to be a dentist, dental surgeon, qualified dentist, doctor of dental surgery, professor of dentistry or surgeon dentist;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: takes or uses the name or title of a dentist, dental surgeon, qualified dentist, doctor of dental surgery, professor of dentistry or surgeon dentist; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: takes or uses any name, title, addition or description implying (whether in itself or in the circumstances in which it is used) that the person— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 68)

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is a dentist; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: is qualified to practise dentistry. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 68)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: An enrolled dental hygienist (within the meaning of the Ancillary Dental Workers (Dental Hygienists) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. B)) does not commit an offence under subsection (1) because he or she takes or uses any name, title, addition or description implying (whether in itself or in the circumstances in which it is used) that he or she is qualified to undertake the kinds of dental work prescribed in regulation 6(1) of those Regulations. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 68)
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s25A
section.heading: Penalty for falsely pretending to be or taking or using the name or title of a specialist

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: his name is not included in the Specialist Register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: he wilfully or falsely—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: pretends that his name is included in the Specialist Register; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: takes or uses any name, title, addition or description implying (whether in itself or in the circumstances in which it is used) that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: he is a specialist dentist; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: his name is included in the Specialist Register.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether or not the person is a registered dentist; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether or not the person is deemed to be a registered dentist under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Liability of registrants for allowing another to contravene certain requirements of this Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: A registrant commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registrant allows another person to practise dentistry on any premises used by or under the control of the registrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person is not a registrant.

subsection.leadIn: A registrant commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that person is not a registrant.

subsection.leadIn: A registrant commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the registrant knows or has reason to believe that another person—

subparagraph.content: is not a registrant; but
practises dentistry on any premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registrant practises dentistry on the premises.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1), (2) or (3) is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (1) or (2), it is a defence to establish that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the commission of the offence was due to a mistake on the person’s part, or due to reliance on information supplied to the person, or due to the act of another person or any other cause beyond the person’s control; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person exercised all due diligence to avoid committing the offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for a defence under subsection (5) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to the matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

content.i: (Addition not yet in operation—see 22 of 2024 s. 71)

section.name: s27A
section.heading: Restoration of persons whose names have been removed from registers

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the name was so removed on an order made under section 18 or 18A with a right to apply for restoration under this section after the expiry of a period; or
the name was so removed on an order made under section 15(3) or 15K(4).

subsection.content: The person may apply to the Council for the restoration of the person’s name to the original part.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for subsection (1)(b)(i)—be made after the expiry of the period mentioned in that subsection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the original part is Part 1 of the General Register—indicate the applicant’s wish, if the application is approved, to have the applicant’s name contained in the practising list or the non-practising list.

subsection.content: The Council may, after any inquiry and subject to any condition that it considers appropriate, approve or reject the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Council must notify the Registrar of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Council’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected—the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: On receiving a notification under subsection (5), the Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the application is approved—

subparagraph.content: notify the applicant in writing of the Council’s decision; and
after the prescribed fee has been paid, restore the applicant’s name to the original part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is rejected, notify the applicant in writing of the Council’s decision and the reason for it.

subsection.leadIn: If, before the name was removed, the person was a person with limited registration or a person with special registration, the registration of the person effected by the restoration of the person’s name under this section is to be in force until the earliest of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the termination of the person’s employment mentioned in section 9D(2)(a) or 9K(2)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the removal of the person’s name from Part 3 or 5 of the General Register under an order made under section 15, 18 or 18A.

subsection.content: If the original part is Part 1 of the General Register, the Register must enter the applicant’s name in the practising list or the non-practising list according to the wish indicated under subsection (3)(c).

section.name: s27B
section.heading: Council may issue code of practice

subsection.leadIn: The Council may issue a code of practice for any or all of the following purposes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: setting the standards of conduct and practice for registrants in relation to the practice of dentistry;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidelines regarding the activities of registrants in relation to the practice of dentistry.

subsection.leadIn: The Council—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may issue different codes of practice for different classes of registrants; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may issue different codes of practice for different purposes.

subsection.content: The Council may from time to time revise or revoke the whole, or any part, of a code of practice.
The Secretary must, as soon as practicable after the registration of a person, cause a copy of a code of practice that applies to the person to be sent to the person.

If any part of a code of practice that applies to a person is revised under subsection (3), the Secretary must, as soon as practicable after the revision, cause a copy of the revised part of the code of practice to be sent to the person.

If a code of practice issued or revised under this section (or any part of the code of practice) (former provision) is inconsistent with this Ordinance or regulations made under section 29 (latter provision), the latter provision prevails over the former provision.

section.name: s27C
section.heading: Registrar may request provision of means of contact
section.content: The Registrar may request a person to provide to the Registrar a means of contact (other than an address) for the purposes of section 27D(2)(c).

section.name: s27D
section.heading: Means of service etc.

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice required to be given to a person under section 5Q(1), 7E(5), 9A(5), 9D(5), 9H(4), 9K(5), 12B(5)(b) or (11), 12F(4) or (6), 15E(6) or 27A(6);

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: a summons mentioned in section 19(2).

subsection.leadIn: The document is to be regarded as having been given or sent to, or served on, a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is delivered personally;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is sent by post—

subparagraph.content: if the person is a registrant—to the last registered address provided by the person to the Registrar; or
if the person is not a registrant—to the person’s address last known to the Registrar; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is sent by using a means of contact provided under section 27C.

subsection.leadIn: The document is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be regarded as having been given or sent to, or served on, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is delivered personally—on the day on which it is delivered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is sent by post—on the day after the day on which it is sent; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if it is sent by using a means of contact provided under section 27C—on the day on which it is sent.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Forfeiture

subsection.content: Where a person has been convicted of an offence against section 3(1) or (1B), a magistrate may, on application made on behalf of the Government, order that all dental materials and equipment in the possession or under the control of such person shall be forfeited to the Government. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 74)

Upon the making of an order for forfeiture under this section, the materials and equipment to which such order relates shall be deemed to be the property of the Government free from the rights of any person.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended 37 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any fee required to be paid under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disposal of any fee paid or recovered under this Ordinance. (Replaced 80 of 1997 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Health may by regulation provide for— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the functions of a Legal Adviser; and

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: the establishment of classes of ancillary dental workers to undertake dental work of kinds prescribed by the regulations, being dental work amounting to the practice of dentistry, within the meaning of section 2(2), and in particular—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the qualifications for becoming a member of any such class;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the dental work which a member of any such class may undertake and the conditions, if any, under which he may do so;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the establishment of a roll or record of such classes; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the title to be used by a member of any such class indicating his membership. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1AB
subsection.content: The Permanent Secretary for Health may by regulation provide for the procedure and other matters relating to an election for appointment to the Council under section 4, including the qualifications of candidates, the eligibility requirements for electors and subscribers for a nomination form, the particulars of any system of voting and counting, the determination of election results and questioning of the results. (Added 22 of 2024 s. 75)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The Registrar may by regulation provide for—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the manner in which applications for registrations shall be made. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 7)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Subject to the approval of the Secretary for Health, the Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007; L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the procedure to be followed at meetings of the Council, a committee established under section 5AC or a subcommittee established under section 5AD, and the procedure to be followed by the members of the Council, committee or subcommittee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the receipt of complaints or information about a registrant or an applicant for registration;

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: the ascertainment by the chairperson of a Preliminary Investigation Committee as to whether a complaint or information about any registered dentist involves a suitability issue and the referral of such a complaint or information involving a suitability issue to the Education and Accreditation Committee; (Added 11 of 2006 s. 22)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the prohibition of a member of a Preliminary Investigation Committee who is also a member of the Council from attending any meeting of the Council while it is inquiring into a complaint or information, in the preliminary investigation of which he took part;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the procedure to be followed in relation to—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: the preliminary investigation of any complaint or information by a Preliminary Investigation Committee;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the formulation of charges arising out of complaints or information;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the reference to the Council by a Preliminary Investigation Committee of cases arising out of complaints or information;

subparagraph.name: v

subparagraph.content: reviews and appeals under this Ordinance; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 75)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: the procedure and other matters relating to an election for appointment to the Council under section 4, including the qualifications of candidates, the eligibility requirements for electors and subscribers for a nomination form, the particulars of any system of voting and counting, the determination of election results and questioning of the results; (Added 22 of 2024 s. 75)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.content: the regulation of the activities of registrants in relation to the practice of dentistry; and (Added 22 of 2024 s. 75)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the form of any certificate, form or other document which is a certificate, form or other document to be used for a purpose of this Ordinance and required to be prescribed. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 7. Amended 11 of 2006 s. 22)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsections (1A), (1AB), (1B) and (1C), regulations made under subsections (1A), (1AB) and (1C) may— (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 75)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: require documents for a purpose of this Ordinance to be submitted and to be in such form as may be prescribed and require matters or documents for that purpose to be supported by statutory declarations or such other declarations as specified or approved by the Council;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: provide for any incidental, supplemental, evidential, consequential, savings and transitional provisions that are necessary and expedient in consequence of the regulations; and (Added 22 of 2024 s. 75)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: generally provide for the carrying into effect the provisions of this Ordinance. (Added 80 of 1997 s. 7)

subsection.content: Any regulations made under subsection (1)(a) may prescribe different fees to be payable by different categories of persons. (Added 49 of 1977 s. 11. Amended 80 of 1997 s. 7)

section.name: s29A
section.heading: Power of Council to specify forms, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Council may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form and manner of making an application under this Ordinance; and (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 76)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of a certificate or any other document required, or authorized, to be issued under this Ordinance. (Replaced 22 of 2024 s. 76)

subsection.leadIn: The Council’s power under subsection (1)(a) may be exercised in such a way as to include (whether by way of attachment or otherwise) in the specified form a statutory declaration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to be made by a person completing the form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of the person’s knowledge and belief. (Amended 22 of 2024 s. 76)

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under subsection (1)(a) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with such directions and instructions as are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by such statements, certificates or any other documents as are specified in the form.

section.name: s29B
section.heading: Secretary for Health may give directions

subsection.content: The Secretary for Health may, if the Secretary for Health considers it is in the public interest, give written directions of a general or specific character to the Council in relation to the performance of its functions.
The Council must comply with any direction given under subsection (1).

section.name: s29C
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this section by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.content: The Council may, subject to the approval of the Legislative Council, amend Schedule 1 by notice published in the Gazette.
Subject to the approval of the Secretary for Health, the Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 2.
The Secretary for Health may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10 or 11.
The Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 9.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Exemptions from requirements relating to provision of address and registration etc.

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Amendments made by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) to this section are partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024 and L.N. 183 of 2024.)

subsection.content: All registrants in the public service of Hong Kong shall, while in the discharge of their duties or while practising dentistry otherwise than for gain in a charitable clinic approved by the Council, be exempt from sections 12G and 15I.

All dentists of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army residing in Hong Kong shall, while in the discharge of their duties or while practising dentistry otherwise than for gain in a charitable clinic approved by the Council, be deemed to be registered dentists for the purpose of section 3, and Divisions 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 of Part 11, and sections 11A and 12G do not apply to such dentists unless they practise dentistry privately in Hong Kong. (Amended 2 of 2012 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: All persons on the full-time teaching staff of the Faculty of Dentistry of the University of Hong Kong shall, while in the discharge of teaching duties or while performing hospital work in the Faculty of Dentistry—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be deemed to be registered dentists for the purpose of section 3,

subsection.continued: unless they practise dentistry privately within Hong Kong. (Replaced 34 of 1995 s. 7)

subsection.content: All registrants in the full-time service of the Hospital Authority are exempt from sections 12G and 15I, unless they practise dentistry privately in Hong Kong. (Added 87 of 1991 s. 2)

section.name: s31
section.heading: Exemptions

subsection.content: Nothing in this Ordinance shall operate to prevent the practice of medicine or surgery by a medical practitioner registered under the Medical Registration Ordinance (Cap. 161).

Nothing in this Ordinance shall operate to prevent the training of medical students, dental students, dental therapists or dental hygienists in the practice of dentistry under the supervision of a registered dentist or a person deemed to be a registered dentist during a course of training operated by an institution approved by the Chief Executive for the purpose of this section. (Replaced 79 of 1984 s. 6. Amended 62 of 1987 s. 9; 37 of 2000 s. 3)

Nothing in this Ordinance shall operate to prevent the performance by dental therapists employed in the public service of minor dental work of such a character as may be authorized in writing by a government consultant dental surgeon appointed by the Director of Health for that purpose. (Amended 10 of 1966 s. 3; 79 of 1984 s. 6; L.N. 76 of 1989)

This Ordinance does not prevent the operation of an irradiating apparatus by a person authorized to operate the apparatus under regulation 26 of the Radiation (Control of Irradiating Apparatus) Regulations (Cap. 303 sub. leg. B). (Added 22 of 2024 s. 79)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Transitional

subsection.content: If the Council has, before the commencement* of section 7(3), approved a registered dentist to use, or be known in, a specialist title for a specialty, and the approval is in effect immediately before that commencement, the Registrar shall, on that commencement, include the dentist’s name in the Specialist Register under the specialty.

The Registrar shall, on receipt of payment of the prescribed fee, issue a certificate, in the form specified by the Council, to the effect that a registered dentist’s name has been included in the Specialist Register under subsection (1) under a specialty.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Savings and transitional provisions for Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024)
section.content: The savings and transitional provisions in Schedule 11 have effect.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Regulations for consequential amendments consequent on enactment of Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024)

subsection.content: The Secretary for Health may by regulation make consequential or related amendments to any enactment as are necessary consequent on the enactment of the Amendment Ordinance.
For the purposes of subsection (1), regulations made under that subsection may include savings and transitional provisions relating to the consequential or related amendments.

Regulations made under subsection (1) may provide for any provision of the regulations to take effect on a date earlier than the date of publication of the regulations (publication date) but not earlier than the day on which section 80 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation*.

subsection.leadIn: To the extent to which a provision of regulations made under subsection (1) takes effect on a date earlier than the publication date, the provision does not operate so as—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to impose liabilities on a person (other than the Government or a public body) in respect of anything done, or omitted to be done, before the publication date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024).

editorialNote.content: * Date of coming into operation: 1 January 2025.
