schedule.name: sch9
schedule.heading: Provisions with respect to Committee Established under Section 5AC and Subcommittee Established under Section 5AD

leadIn.editorialNote: (Note : Addition of this Schedule by the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024) is partially commenced—see L.N. 146 of 2024.)

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: committee (委員會) means a committee established under section 5AC;
subcommittee (委員會小組) means a subcommittee established under section 5AD.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Terms of members

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3) and section 3 of this Schedule, a member of a committee (other than one established under section 5AC(2))—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for the period specified in the member’s letter of appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3) and section 3 of this Schedule, a member of a subcommittee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds office for the period specified in the member’s letter of appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.content: A member of a committee or subcommittee may at any time resign by giving written notice to the Chairperson or Secretary.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Vacation of office
section.content: If an order is made under section 18 or 18A in respect of a member of a committee or subcommittee, the member ceases to be such a member.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Temporary members

subsection.content: If a member of a committee is temporarily unable to perform the functions as a member of the committee during a period, another person who is eligible for appointment as such a member may be appointed by the Chairperson to be temporarily a member of the committee during the period.

If a member of a subcommittee established by a committee is temporarily unable to perform the functions as a member of the subcommittee during a period, another person who is eligible for appointment as such a member may be appointed by the Chairperson, or the chairperson of the committee, to be temporarily a member of the subcommittee during the period.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Outgoing member to continue transacting business

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a committee or subcommittee is considering a complaint or an information, or conducting a hearing or review, at the time when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of resignation is given by a person under section 2(3) of this Schedule; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the membership or temporary membership of the committee or subcommittee of a person terminates otherwise than by resignation.

subsection.leadIn: The person must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person that is a member of a committee—if requested by the Council or the Chairperson, continue to be a member of the committee for the purpose of completing the performance of the person’s function in respect of that complaint, information, hearing or review and for no other purpose; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person that is a member of a subcommittee—if requested by the Council, the Chairperson, the committee that established the subcommittee or the chairperson of the committee, continue to be a member of the subcommittee for the purpose of completing the performance of the person’s function in respect of that complaint, information, hearing or review and for no other purpose.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meetings

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of a committee or subcommittee—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: except for a committee established under section 5AC(2), if the chairperson is absent, the members present must elect one of them to preside at the meeting.

subsection.content: A question for determination at any meeting of a committee or subcommittee must be decided by a majority of the members present and voting on the question.
At any meeting of a committee or subcommittee, the chairperson of the committee or subcommittee has an original vote and, if on any question the votes are equally divided, a casting vote.
Subject to subsection (5), a committee or subcommittee may transact any of its business by circulation of papers.
Subsection (4) does not apply to a committee established under section 5AC(2)(d) or (e) or a subcommittee established by such a committee.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (8), on the circulation of papers, a written resolution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of which all members of the committee or subcommittee indicate their votes in writing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: passed by the number of members required for passing the resolution at a meeting of the committee or subcommittee,

subsection.continued: is as valid as if it had been passed at a meeting of the committee or subcommittee by the members who vote on the resolution.

subsection.content: A member of a committee or subcommittee may, by giving a written notice to the chairperson of the committee or subcommittee within the period specified in the papers being circulated, request the chairperson to refer a matter to be determined by circulating the papers to a meeting of the committee or subcommittee for determination.

If a member gives a notice under subsection (7) in relation to a matter, a resolution that relates to the matter passed in accordance with subsection (6)(b) is invalid to the extent that it so relates.
For the purposes of this section, a reference to the circulation of papers includes the circulation of information by electronic means.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Secretary

subsection.content: The Council may appoint a person to be a secretary to a committee.
A committee establishing a subcommittee may appoint a person to be a secretary to the subcommittee.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Procedure
section.content: Except where express provision about the procedure of a committee or subcommittee is made in this Ordinance or regulations made under section 29, a committee or subcommittee may regulate its own procedure.

section.name: s1
section.content: For a person who has not worked under full-time employment as a person with special registration in any Schedule 5 institution at any time during the period mentioned in section 8(1)(c)(i)—the person has passed the clinical part of the Licensing Examination.

section.name: s2
section.content: For a person who has worked under full-time employment as a person with special registration in one or more Schedule 5 institutions at any time during the period mentioned in section 8(1)(c)(i)—the person has passed, or been exempted under section 7C from, the clinical part of the Licensing Examination.

schedule.name: sch11
schedule.heading: Savings and Transitional Provisions for Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 1 of Schedule 11

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: amended Ordinance (《經修訂條例》) means this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance;
Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 35 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
existing prescribed fee (原有訂明費用), in relation to a matter, means the fee prescribed for the matter in the pre-amended Regulation;
existing register (原有名冊) means the General Register kept under section 7(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance;
new register (新名冊) means the General Register kept under section 7(1) of the amended Ordinance;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-amended Regulation (《原有規例》) means the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is on the resident list of the existing register if the name of the person is contained in the form mentioned in regulation 3(a) of the pre-amended Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person is on the non-resident list of the existing register if the name of the person is contained in the form mentioned in regulation 3(b) of the pre-amended Regulation,

subsection.continued: and references to the resident list and the non-resident list are to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Registration and register

subsection.content: On the commencement date, an existing registrant is to be regarded as a person with full registration.

subsection.leadIn: Accordingly, the Registrar must, on the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: transfer the name and particulars of each existing registrant on the resident list of the existing register to the practising list of Part 1 of the new register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: transfer the name and particulars of each existing registrant on the non-resident list of the existing register to the non-practising list of Part 1 of the new register.

subsection.leadIn: On the transfer of a person’s name and particulars under subsection (2)(b), the person is to be regarded as having been issued a retention certificate under section 12I(3) of the amended Ordinance that is, subject to section 12I(7) of the amended Ordinance, to be in force until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the commencement date falls on a date not later than 30 June of a year—the end of that year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the commencement date falls on a date later than 30 June of a year—the end of the following year.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Addresses

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose name and particulars are transferred to the new register under section 2(2) of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the name and particulars of the person are transferred under section 2(2)(a) of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if only one address is transferred—that address is to be regarded as an address provided on the commencement date by the person under section 12G(1) and (2) of the amended Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if more than one address is so transferred—

subparagraph.content: all those addresses are to be regarded as addresses provided on the commencement date by the person under section 12G(2) of the amended Ordinance; and

the latest address indicated by the person to the Registrar before the commencement date as the correspondence address is to be regarded as an address provided on the commencement date by the person under section 12G(1) of the amended Ordinance.

subsection.content: If the name and particulars of the person are transferred under section 2(2)(b) of this Schedule, the address in Hong Kong so transferred is to be regarded as an address provided on the commencement date by the person under section 12G(1) of the amended Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Existing certification of registration

subsection.content: On and after the commencement date, a certificate of registration issued under section 10(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date continues to be in force as if it were issued under section 10 of the amended Ordinance to a person with full registration.

Accordingly, a duplicate or certified copy of such a certificate is to be regarded as a duplicate or certified copy of a certificate of registration issued under section 10 of the amended Ordinance to a person with full registration.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Pending application for registration

subsection.content: An application made under section 9 of the pre-amended Ordinance that was pending immediately before the commencement date is, subject to subsections (2) and (3), to continue to be processed under that section.

subsection.leadIn: If an application referred to in subsection (1) is approved on or after the commencement date, the Registrar must, after the existing prescribed fee has been paid—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: enter the applicant’s name in—

subparagraph.content: if the applicant indicated that the applicant wished, if the application was approved, to have the applicant’s name contained in the resident list of the existing register—the practising list of Part 1 of the new register; or

if the applicant indicated that the applicant wished, if the application was approved, to have the applicant’s name contained in the non-resident list of the existing register—the non-practising list of Part 1 of the new register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue to the applicant a certificate of registration under section 10 of the amended Ordinance.

subsection.content: If an application referred to in subsection (1) is rejected on or after the commencement date, the decision is to be regarded as a decision made by the Council to reject an application under section 9A(3) of the amended Ordinance and sections 9A(4) and (5) and 23 of the amended Ordinance apply in relation to the decision accordingly.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Pending application for restoration of name to register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person has, before the commencement date, applied to the Council for the restoration of the person’s name to the existing register under section 22(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application was pending immediately before the commencement date.

subsection.content: The application is, subject to subsection (3), to continue to be processed under section 22(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is allowed on or after the commencement date, the Registrar must, after the existing prescribed fee has been paid, enter the applicant’s name in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicant indicated that the applicant wished, if the application was allowed, to have the applicant’s name contained in the resident list of the existing register—the practising list of Part 1 of the new register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant indicated that the applicant wished, if the application was allowed, to have the applicant’s name contained in the non-resident list of the existing register—the non-practising list of Part 1 of the new register.

subsection.content: On entering the person’s name under this section, the certificate of registration issued to the person under section 10(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the removal is to be regarded as being in force as if it were issued under section 10 of the amended Ordinance to a person with full registration.

Accordingly, a duplicate or certified copy of such a certificate is to be regarded as a duplicate or certified copy of a certificate of registration issued under section 10 of the amended Ordinance to a person with full registration.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Restoration of name removed under pre-amended Ordinance (other than one removed for specified period)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a person’s name was removed from the existing register under section 15(3) or 18(1)(i) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: there was no pending application under section 22(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance for the restoration of the person’s name to the existing register immediately before the commencement date; or
there was such an application immediately before the commencement date and the application was refused.

subsection.content: Section 27A of the amended Ordinance applies in relation to the person as if the person’s name were removed from Part 1 of the new register on an order made under section 15(3) of the amended Ordinance.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Restoration of name removed under pre-amended Ordinance for specified period

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a person’s name was removed from the existing register for a period under section 18(1)(ii) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: there was no pending application under section 22(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance for the restoration of the person’s name to the existing register immediately before the commencement date; or
there was such an application immediately before the commencement date and the application was refused.

subsection.content: Section 27A of the amended Ordinance applies in relation to the person as if the person’s name were removed from Part 1 of the new register on an order made under section 18 of the amended Ordinance with a right to apply for restoration under section 27A of the amended Ordinance after the expiry of the period.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Existing practising certificate
section.leadIn: On and after the commencement date, a practising certificate issued to a person under section 11A(2) of the pre-amended Ordinance that was in force immediately before the commencement date continues to be in force for the unexpired period as if it were a practising certificate issued under section 11A(2) of the amended Ordinance to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a person mentioned in section 11A(8)(a) of the pre-amended Ordinance—a person with full registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a person mentioned in section 11A(8)(b) of the pre-amended Ordinance—a person with limited registration.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Pending application for practising certificate

subsection.content: An application made by a person under section 11A of the pre-amended Ordinance that was pending immediately before the commencement date is, subject to subsection (2), to continue to be processed under that section.

subsection.leadIn: If an application referred to in subsection (1) is approved on or after the commencement date, the Council must, after the existing prescribed fee has been paid, issue a practising certificate under section 11A of the amended Ordinance to the person as if the application were made by—

paragraph.name: a
b

part.name: P2
part.heading: Matters relating to Council and Committees

section.name: s11
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 2 of Schedule 11
section.def: amended Ordinance (《經修訂條例》) means this Ordinance as amended by the Amendment Ordinance;
Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024);
commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 10(4) of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
former Council (前牙管會) means the Council established under section 4 of the pre-amended Ordinance;
former EAC (前教評委) means the Education and Accreditation Committee established under section 5B of the pre-amended Ordinance;
former PIC (前初調委) means the Preliminary Investigation Committee established under regulation 12 of the pre-amended Regulation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-amended Regulation (《原有規例》) means the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Former Council members

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a person was appointed as a member of the former Council described in section 4(2)(ba), (c), (d) or (e) of the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement date, the term of office of the member has not yet expired.

subsection.content: Despite section 4 of the pre-amended Ordinance, the term of office of the person is, subject to section 17(3) of this Schedule, to be regarded as having expired when the commencement date begins.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Secretary of, and Legal Adviser to, Council

subsection.content: On and after the commencement date, the person appointed under section 4(6) of the pre-amended Ordinance as the Secretary of the former Council and was holding office immediately before that date continues to hold office as the Secretary of the Council as if the person were appointed under section 4AAF(1)(a) of the amended Ordinance.

On and after the commencement date, the person appointed under section 4(6) of the pre-amended Ordinance as the Legal Adviser to the former Council and was holding office immediately before that date continues to hold office as a Legal Adviser to the Council as if the person were appointed under section 4AAF(1)(b) of the amended Ordinance.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Former members of Education and Accreditation Committee

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a person was appointed as a member of the former EAC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement date, the term of office of the member has not yet expired.

subsection.content: Despite section 5B of the pre-amended Ordinance, the term of office of the person is to be regarded as having expired when the commencement date begins.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Former members of Preliminary Investigation Committee

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a person was appointed or elected as a member of the former PIC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: immediately before the commencement date, the term of office of the member has not yet expired.

subsection.content: Despite regulation 12 of the pre-amended Regulation, the term of office of the person is, subject to section 16(3) of this Schedule, to be regarded as having expired when the commencement date begins.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Complaint or information submitted to former PIC

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the Secretary has submitted a complaint or an information to the former PIC under regulation 13 of the pre-amended Regulation; or
a complaint or an information has been referred back to the former PIC under regulation 19(1) of the pre-amended Regulation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the complaint or information has not been disposed of by the former PIC.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b), a complaint or an information has been disposed of by the former PIC if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairman of the former PIC has directed under regulation 15(1) of the pre-amended Regulation that the complaint or information should not proceed further on ground that it is frivolous or groundless; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former PIC has determined under regulation 15A(2) of the pre-amended Regulation as to whether the complaint or information is to be referred to the Council for inquiry.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulations 14, 15, 15A, 16 and 17 of the pre-amended Regulation continue to apply in relation to the consideration of the complaint or information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the extent that it relates to the consideration of the complaint or information, regulation 12 of the pre-amended Regulation continues to apply in relation to the membership of the former PIC (including a vacancy in the membership).

subsection.content: If the former PIC makes a determination under regulation 15A(2)(b) of the pre-amended Regulation to refer the complaint or information to the Council, the determination is, for the purposes of this Ordinance (other than regulation 19 of the pre-amended Regulation), to be regarded as being made by a Preliminary Investigation Committee under regulation 15A(2)(b) of the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A) as in force at the time of the determination.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Cases referred to Council

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former PIC determined under regulation 15A(2)(b) of the pre-amended Regulation to refer a case against a person (person charged) to the former Council for an inquiry to be held;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary has read the notice of inquiry at the opening of an inquiry held for the case in accordance with regulation 25(1) of the pre-amended Regulation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the case has not been disposed of by the former Council.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c), a case has been disposed of by the former Council if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the former Council has announced under regulation 28(4) or 29(4) of the pre-amended Regulation that the person charged is not guilty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the former Council has announced under regulation 28(4) or 29(4) of the pre-amended Regulation that the person charged is guilty and a sentence has been announced under regulation 31(2) of the pre-amended Regulation.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sections 18, 19, 20 and 21 of the pre-amended Ordinance, and regulation 23 and Part IV of the pre-amended Regulation, continue to apply in relation to the hearing of the inquiry; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to the extent that it relates to the hearing of the inquiry, section 4 of the pre-amended Ordinance continues to apply in relation to the membership of the former Council (including a vacancy in the membership).

section.name: s18
section.heading: Complaint or information referred back to former PIC

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before the commencement date, a complaint or an information has been referred by the former PIC to the former Council under regulation 17(1) of the pre-amended Regulation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the commencement date, a complaint or an information is referred by the former PIC to the Council under regulation 17(1) of the pre-amended Regulation because of the operation of section 16 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: On and after the commencement date, the Council may continue to exercise the power to refer the complaint or information back to the former PIC under regulation 19(1) of the pre-amended Regulation.

If the Council refers a complaint or an information back to the former PIC under subsection (2), section 16 of this Schedule applies in relation to the complaint or information as if it were a complaint or information referred back to the former PIC under regulation 19(1) of the pre-amended Regulation before the commencement date.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 3 of Schedule 11
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Dentists Registration (Amendment) Ordinance 2024 (22 of 2024);
*commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 119 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
existing prescribed fee (原有訂明費用), in relation to a matter, means the fee prescribed for the matter in the pre-amended Regulation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;
pre-amended Regulation (《原有規例》) means the Dentists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. A) as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Fee for inclusion in Specialist Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the inclusion of a person’s name in the Specialist Register under section 12B of the pre-amended Ordinance was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is approved on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the inclusion of the person’s name in the Specialist Register is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Fee for certificate of standing

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a certificate of standing mentioned in regulation 8B(b)(i) of the pre-amended Regulation was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the certificate is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Fee for certificate verifying registration or inclusion of name in Specialist Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a certificate verifying registration or the inclusion of name in the Specialist Register mentioned in regulation 8B(b)(ii) of the pre-amended Regulation was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the certificate is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Fee for certified copy of entry in General Register or Specialist Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a certified copy of an entry in the General Register or Specialist Register mentioned in regulation 8B(a)(i) of the pre-amended Regulation was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certified copy is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the certified copy is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Fee for certificate for inclusion of name in Specialist Register under section 32 of pre-amended Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a certificate mentioned in section 32 of the pre-amended Ordinance was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certificate is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the certificate is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Fee for duplicate certificate of registration or duplicate certificate for inclusion of name in Specialist Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a duplicate certificate of registration or a duplicate certificate for the inclusion of name in the Specialist Register mentioned in regulation 8B(a)(ii) of the pre-amended Regulation was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the duplicate certificate is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the duplicate certificate is the existing prescribed fee.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Fee for certified copy of certificate of registration or certificate for inclusion of name in Specialist Register

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a certified copy of a certificate of registration or a certificate for the inclusion of name in the Specialist Register mentioned in regulation 8B(a)(iii) of the pre-amended Regulation was made before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the certified copy is issued on or after the commencement date.

subsection.content: The fee payable for the issue of the certified copy is the existing prescribed fee.
